author: Min Sun Lee
title: Olympic Organizers’ Latest Hurdle: a Contagious Stomach Bug
text:
SEOUL—Organizers of this year’s Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang have had to contend with security fears, transportation problems and the unpredictability of the North Korean regime.
Their latest challenge: an outbreak of the highly contagious norovirus that has sickened dozens of Olympic security officials and forced more than a thousand into quarantine a few days before the Games begin.
Organizers... RELATED VIDEO Pyeongchang, a tiny ski resort in a remote corner of South Korea, has transformed itself into the host of the largest-ever Winter Olympics. Here’s how the Games look from a drone’s perspective. To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
